lexUnit.name: wave.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move one's hand to and fro in greeting or as a signal

sentence.text: He was seen to wave that he was O.K. to one of the other aircraft .
Mandy spotted them and waved that they were all right , and Matthew turned and headed them into a safe cove , too .
Roquelaure waved him to silence .
A uniformed policeman had stepped out from the kerb up ahead and was waving them into a side road .
Right on cue , the telephone rang and I waved Mrs Bradshaw into my lounge .
Jacob waved them into silence .
When Christian tried to interrupt the angry outburst , Boz waved him into silence .
They waved him into the Customs ' Hall .
Catherine waved us into the hall and we sat in the window seat .
Figures appeared in the road ahead , waving them into the yard of the farmhouse .
He winked and waved her to a chair , then turned his attention back to the caller .
Norman Fowler waved the group to a half-circle of uncomfortable chairs .
The VOPO in the civilian Wartburg frantically waved his colleagues to a stop and explained what had happened .
In fact I went to wave goodbye to grandma .
I waved goodbye to the rest of the team .
Spring is here so it 's time to wave goodbye to winter and go for a splash of colour .
The torturers were waved back by a senior clerk who had accompanied the French King to the dungeon .
Peter nodded , and we were waved through .
He was waved ahead .
Luke waved her ahead .
He waves for me to follow .
Against the roar of rage he waved for silence .
Cornelius waved off his companion .
